thread.title: HS playdowns: South Burlington rallies past MAU
thread.title_full: HS playdowns: South Burlington rallies past MAU

title: HS playdowns: South Burlington rallies past MAU
text:
HS playdowns: South Burlington rallies past MAU Free Press Sports Staff 11:40 p.m. EDT October 21, 2015 Buy Photo Essex's Jessica Poratti, left, and BFA-St. Albans' Makenna Larrow get their feet on the ball in Essex on Wednesday. (Photo: GLENN RUSSELL/FREE PRESS) Buy Photo CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BENNINGTON - Erasing a two-goal halftime deficit, 11th-seeded South Burlington rallied after the break to post a 3-2 win over No. 6 Mount Anthony in the Division I high school girls soccer playdowns on Wednesday. 
Annika Nielsen got the Rebels (7-7-1) on the board in the 48th minute and Posie Nash-Gibney struck from 40 yards on a free kick to equalize 2-2 midway through the second half. 
Cameron Peyko notched the game-winner on a feed from Bella Navin with 10 minutes to play and Bailey Burt stopped six shots in net. 
Bridget Ahearn and Kaidin Gauthier tallied for the Patriots (9-6) and Erika McCarthy made 11 saves. 
• (8) Essex 2, (9) BFA-St. Albans 1: Jess Poratti scored each side of halftime as host Essex held off BFA-St. Albans. 
Marisa Minadeo assisted the Hornets (8-6-1) first strike and Megan Macfarlane set up the second. Hannah Bovee finished with six saves. 
Jenna McCracken got a goal back for the Comets with 6:16 to play and goalie Jessie Casey made 16 stops. 
• (3) Champlain Valley 3, (14) North Country 0: Megan Gannon scored twice in the first half and Ali Bisaccia added to the lead after halftime to push CVU past visiting North Country. 
Bisaccia, Catherine Cazayoux and Sara Kelley each had an assist for the Redhawks (12-2), who got a one-save shutout from Michaela Flore. 
Melody Martin made 16 saves for North Country (5-10). 
•(4) Mount Mansfield 1, (13) St. Johnsbury 0: Jordan Pelland scored in just the second minute off an assist from Fiona Tynion to provide the decisive strike in host Mount Mansfield’s win over St. Johnsbury. 
Emma Parent registered six saves in the shutout for the Cougars (10-5). 
Samantha Turgeon had 11 saves in net for the Hilltoppers (5-8-1). 
•(5) Rutland 3, (12) Burlington 0: Rutland’s Jordan DelBianco scored twice and Brooke Woodard registered a third score to send the host Raiders past the Burlington. 
Loren Henderson had seven saves for Rutland (10-5). 
Goalkeeper Norah Mitchell had seven saves for the Seahorses (6-9). Buy Photo BFA-St. Albans' Jenna McCracken, left, tries to take the ball from Essex's Samantha Serrantonio in Essex Junction on Wednesday, October 21, 2015. GLENN RUSSELL/FREE PRESS Fullscreen Buy Photo Essex's Jessica Poratti, left, and BFA-St. Albans' Makenna Larrow get their feet on the ball in Essex Junction on Wednesday, October 21, 2015. GLENN RUSSELL/FREE PRESS
